summary: This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL Supervisor Rounds log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering August 9-10, 2019. It records routine security checks, including PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) rounds, in various housing units, including the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a cell marked 'SUICIDE RM'. The log was created in the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Anderson-Layne, Gleta

events.title: Prison Security Rounds at MCC
events.description: Routine supervisor security rounds were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including PREA checks and checks of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a 'SUICIDE RM' cell.

keyFacts: The log documents prison security activity on August 9-10, 2019, the dates surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
Rounds were conducted in a cell specifically designated 'SUICIDE RM', which is highly relevant to the circumstances of Epstein's death.
The logs include PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) rounds, indicating standard protocol for inmate safety checks.
Multiple Bureau of Prisons staff members are recorded as conducting these supervisory rounds across different shifts.
The document is part of the official prison record-keeping system (TRUINTEL) and is marked 'Sensitive But Unclassified' and 'CONFIDENTIAL'.
